title: William and Kate tour LIVE: Royals in traditional wear for day 3 of Pakistan trip
text:
William and Kate are continuing their royal tour of Pakistan today as they head to the town of Chitral - a remote town on the Chitral River in northern Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

The Duke and Duchess stepped out in traditional wear as they landed at an air base in the region.

Firstly, they will start with a visit to a glacier before moving to a nearby village which has suffered from flooding as result of glacier melting.

They will see how buildings and homes have been completely destroyed in the area before watching emergency drills.

Yesterday, marked their first full day of engagements and saw the royal couple visit a number of schools to learn how youngsters are benefiting from the Teach For Pakistan programme, a fast-track teacher training scheme modelled on the UK's successful Teach First.

At one point, William spoke poignantly about Diana after being told girls at the Islamabad school were "big fans" - to which he replied "I was a big fan of my mother too".

They also met Pakistan's President, Arif Alvi, and Prime Minister, Imran Khan before attending a formal event in the evening.
description: The Duke and Duchess stepped out in traditional wear as they landed at an air base in the town of Chitral - a remote town on the Chitral River in northern Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
